item.title: Paul add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "A child who is protected from all controversial ideas is as vulnerable as a child who is protected from every germ. The infection, when it comes- and it will come- may overwhelm the system, be it the immune system or the belief system." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Paul add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Paul add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Paul add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Paul add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Paul add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Paul add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Paul add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Paul add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Paul add a quote by eric hoffer
item.description: "When people are bored, it is primarily with their own selves that they are bored." -- eric hoffer

item.title: Paul add a quote by Metallica
item.description: "Boredom comes from a boring mind." -- Metallica

item.title: Paul add a quote by Lee Iacocca
item.description: "In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else." -- Lee Iacocca

item.title: Paul add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Paul add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "Sometimes the road less traveled is less traveled for a reason" -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Paul add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Paul add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "What we obtain too cheap, we esteem too lightly: it is dearness only that gives every thing its value. Heaven knows how to put a proper price upon its goods; and it would be strange indeed if so celestial an article as freedom should not be highly rated." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Paul add a quote by Abraham Maslow
item.description: "I suppose it is tempting, if the only tool you have is a hammer, to treat everything as if it were a nail." -- Abraham Maslow

item.title: Paul add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Paul add a quote by Winston Groom
item.description: "Stupid is as stupid looks." -- Winston Groom

item.title: Paul add a quote by Lee Ezell
item.description: "Pray to God, but row towards shore." -- Lee Ezell

item.title: Paul add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Paul add a quote by William James
item.description: "The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude." -- William James

item.title: Paul add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "If Jesus came back and saw what was being done in his name, he'd never stop throwing up." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Paul add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well." -- Aristotle

item.title: Paul add a quote by Phil Collins
item.description: "In learning you will teach, and in teaching you will learn." -- Phil Collins

item.title: Paul add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Paul add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Paul add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "I'd give my right arm to be ambidextrous." -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Paul add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The formulation of the problem is often more essential than its solution, which may be merely a matter of mathematical or experimental skill." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Paul add a quote by Tim Freeman
item.description: "When they took the Fourth Amendment, I was silent because I don't deal drugs. When they took the Sixth Amendment, I kept quiet because I know I'm innocent. When they took the Second Amendment, I said nothing because I don't own a gun. Now they've come for the First Amendment, and I can't say anything at all." -- Tim Freeman
